Tech leaders like Amazon's Andy Jassy and Nvidia's Jensen Huang acknowledge potential job losses due to automation, while also anticipating new opportunities. Google DeepMind's Demis Hassabis predicts significant workplace changes within the next decade, emphasizing the need for reskilling and collaboration between humans and AI.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/google-deepmind-ceo-demis-hassabis-reveals-ai-can-replace-doctors-in-healthcare-but-not-nurses-heres-how/articleshow/123089003.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/google-deepmind-ceo-demis-hassabis-reveals-ai-can-replace-doctors-in-healthcare-but-not-nurses-heres-how/articleshow/123089003.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 12:19:44 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="21270" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123089023,imgsize-21270.cms"/></item><item><title>Drunk army constable drives onto Meerut railway platform</title><description><![CDATA[An Army constable was arrested in Meerut Cantt for allegedly driving his car onto a railway platform while intoxicated. Railway police intervened, confirming the constable's intoxication through a medical examination.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bareilly/drunk-army-constable-drives-onto-meerut-railway-platform-car-inches-from-train-licence-seized-fir-filed/articleshow/123088677.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bareilly/drunk-army-constable-drives-onto-meerut-railway-platform-car-inches-from-train-licence-seized-fir-filed/articleshow/123088677.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 12:02:38 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>KRISHNA CHAUDHARY</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="27566" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123088663,imgsize-27566.cms"/></item><item><title>Guns, gangs & minors: ‘Lady Don’ Zikra chargesheeted in Seelampur teen murder case</title><description><![CDATA[Delhi Police have filed a chargesheet against Zikra, infamously known as 'Lady Don,' and seven others concerning the murder of a 17-year-old boy in Seelampur. The charges include murder and criminal conspiracy. Zikra, associated with the Mastan gang, allegedly groomed teenagers for criminal activities.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/guns-gangs-minors-lady-don-zikra-chargesheeted-in-seelampur-teen-murder-case/articleshow/123088552.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/guns-gangs-minors-lady-don-zikra-chargesheeted-in-seelampur-teen-murder-case/articleshow/123088552.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 11:58:27 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI CITY DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="781380" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123088584,imgsize-781380.cms"/></item><item><title>'Past mistakes ... ': Ex-India cricketer on IND vs ENG Day 4 pressure battle</title><description><![CDATA[Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar highlighted the intense pressure India exerted on England's batters during the final session of Day 4 in the fifth Test. This initiative aims to create an "answer engine" that can crawl the web and respond to general-knowledge questions.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/apple-forms-new-answers-team-to-build-chatgpt-rival-after-ceo-tim-cook-says-company-rarely-been/articleshow/123091020.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/apple-forms-new-answers-team-to-build-chatgpt-rival-after-ceo-tim-cook-says-company-rarely-been/articleshow/123091020.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 13:53:35 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="175432" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123091029,imgsize-175432.cms"/></item><item><title>Pak IDs, chocolates: 3 killed in Op Mahadev were Lashkar operatives behind Pahalgam attack</title><description><![CDATA[Security agencies have confirmed that the three terrorists killed after the Pahalgam attack were Pakistani nationals, providing irrefutable evidence including government documents and biometric data. The Lashkar-e-Taiba operatives were responsible for the April 22 attack that claimed 26 lives. Recovered items and forensic analysis further solidify Pakistan's direct involvement in the deadly incident.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/pakistan-ids-biometrics-chocolates-three-terrorists-killed-in-operation-mahadev-were-lashkar-operatives-behind-pahalgam-attack-officials-say-no-local-was-involved/articleshow/123088724.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/pakistan-ids-biometrics-chocolates-three-terrorists-killed-in-operation-mahadev-were-lashkar-operatives-behind-pahalgam-attack-officials-say-no-local-was-involved/articleshow/123088724.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 12:20:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1661333" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123089013,imgsize-1661333.cms"/></item><item><title>Yemen shipwreck: 76 dead as boat carrying Ethiopian migrants capsizes</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/rest-of-world/yemen-shipwreck-68-dead-as-boat-carrying-ethiopian-migrants-capsizes-74-still-unaccounted-for/articleshow/123081584.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/rest-of-world/yemen-shipwreck-68-dead-as-boat-carrying-ethiopian-migrants-capsizes-74-still-unaccounted-for/articleshow/123081584.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 00:49:04 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="738628" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123081589,imgsize-738628.cms"/></item><item><title>Meat twice a month, Rs 540/per day: What awaits Prajwal Revanna in Bengaluru prison</title><description><![CDATA[Prajwal Revanna, formerly earning Rs 1.2 lakh monthly as an MP, now faces a stark reality as inmate no. 15528 in Bengaluru Central Prison, where his potential earnings are capped at Rs 540 per month. Awaiting his work assignment, he will adhere to prison routines, including a fixed menu and limited phone calls and visitation.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/from-parliament-debates-to-prison-labour-prajwal-to-get-rs-540-a-month/articleshow/123081167.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/from-parliament-debates-to-prison-labour-prajwal-to-get-rs-540-a-month/articleshow/123081167.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 04:41:54 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>RAJIV KALKOD</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="3513520" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123084362,imgsize-3513520.cms"/></item><item><title>Elon Musk: Many top engineers of Meta are joining my AI company xAI, and I am paying them...</title><description><![CDATA[Elon Musk claims his AI startup, xAI, is attracting Meta engineers without exorbitant salaries, emphasizing its merit-based culture and growth potential. While staying the defamation case, the court questioned Gandhi about the basis of his claim that China occupied 2000 km of Indian land.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/true-indian-wont-make-such-statement-sc-slams-rahul-gandhi-over-army-remark-but-stays-defamation-case/articleshow/123087750.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/true-indian-wont-make-such-statement-sc-slams-rahul-gandhi-over-army-remark-but-stays-defamation-case/articleshow/123087750.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 11:41:14 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="829916" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123088160,imgsize-829916.cms"/></item><item><title>Countering Trump tariff impact: Govt wants exporters to promote homegrown brands</title><description><![CDATA[Faced with a 25% US tariff, the Indian government is urging exporters to develop domestic brands and is considering measures like reduced testing fees for smaller exporters. The focus is on sectors like marine products, which now face increased competition. The government is also exploring employment-linked programs and fixed-price intermediate products to support exporters.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/countering-trumps-25-tariff-impact-on-india-modi-government-wants-exporters-to-build-promote-homegrown-brands-it-is-important-to/articleshow/123088647.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/countering-trumps-25-tariff-impact-on-india-modi-government-wants-exporters-to-build-promote-homegrown-brands-it-is-important-to/articleshow/123088647.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 13:29:13 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="60542" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123090514,imgsize-60542.cms"/></item><item><title>'Certified anti-national': BJP's Amit Malviya accuses Rahul of foreign ties</title><description><![CDATA[BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya has branded Rahul Gandhi a "certified anti-national" following Supreme Court criticism of Gandhi's remarks about the Indian Army. Malviya accused Gandhi of seeking foreign support, engaging with China against national interests, and undermining India's image abroad.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/certified-anti-national-bjps-amit-malviya-accuses-rahul-gandhi-of-foreign-ties-claims-he-signed-mou-with-china/articleshow/123090904.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/certified-anti-national-bjps-amit-malviya-accuses-rahul-gandhi-of-foreign-ties-claims-he-signed-mou-with-china/articleshow/123090904.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 13:56:38 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="723792" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123091052,imgsize-723792.cms"/></item><item><title>Uttarakhand panchayat poll: Declared winner says rival got more votes; seeks recount</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/uttarakhand-panchayat-poll-declared-winner-says-rival-got-more-votes-seeks-recount/articleshow/123089420.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/uttarakhand-panchayat-poll-declared-winner-says-rival-got-more-votes-seeks-recount/articleshow/123089420.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 13:17:48 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="467829" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123090350,imgsize-467829.cms"/></item><item><title>Exclusive | 'Very surprising': Indian World Junior Champ's Grand Swiss entry has a wild backstory</title><description><![CDATA[In a surprise twist, India’s 2025 World Junior Champion Pranav Venkatesh has earned a wildcard entry to the prestigious 2025 FIDE Grand Swiss after defeating Kazakhstan’s GM Kazybek Nogerbek 1.5–0.5 in an unpublicised 'Asian Wildcard Match' in Al Ain, UAE. Pranav, who narrowly missed qualifying by rating, now joins an elite field chasing a spot in the 2026 Candidates.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/chess/exclusive-very-surprising-indias-world-junior-chess-champion-pranav-vs-grand-swiss-2025-entry-has-a-wild-backstory/articleshow/123085953.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/chess/exclusive-very-surprising-indias-world-junior-chess-champion-pranav-vs-grand-swiss-2025-entry-has-a-wild-backstory/articleshow/123085953.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 09:31:05 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>JYOTIRMOY HALDER</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="42668" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123086000,imgsize-42668.cms"/></item><item><title>Cockroaches found in San Francisco-Mumbai Air India flight; airline apologises</title><description><![CDATA[Air India has initiated an investigation following passenger complaints about cockroaches on flight AI180 from San Francisco to Mumbai. The incident, which occurred during the long-haul journey, prompted the airline to relocate affected passengers and conduct a thorough cleaning during a scheduled stop in Kolkata. Air India has apologized for the inconvenience and is working to prevent future occurrences.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/air-india-hygiene-scare-cockroaches-found-in-san-francisco-mumbai-flight-airline-responds/articleshow/123089335.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/air-india-hygiene-scare-cockroaches-found-in-san-francisco-mumbai-flight-airline-responds/articleshow/123089335.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 12:36:55 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SAURABH SINHA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="74894" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123089329,imgsize-74894.cms"/></item><item><title>Malegaon blast verdict: Shankaracharya says 'don't link terrorism with colour'</title><description><![CDATA[The acquittal of all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case has reignited the debate over the term 'Saffron Terror.' Shankaracharya Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati Maharaj condemned linking color with terrorism, emphasizing that a terrorist is simply a terrorist. Political figures have weighed in, with some rejecting the term while others suggest alternatives like 'Hindu fundamentalist' or 'Hindu terrorism.']]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/would-you-worship-bhagwa-terrorist-shankaracharya-avimukteshwaranand-says-dont-link-terrorism-with-colour-questions-failure-to-find-malegaon-blast-culprits/articleshow/123085236.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/would-you-worship-bhagwa-terrorist-shankaracharya-avimukteshwaranand-says-dont-link-terrorism-with-colour-questions-failure-to-find-malegaon-blast-culprits/articleshow/123085236.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 10:07:21 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1084926" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123085783,imgsize-1084926.cms"/></item><item><title>Watch: 20-foot-long whale killed after boat collision; passenger thrown overboard</title><description><![CDATA[A tragic incident occurred in Barnegat Bay. A boat struck a minke whale on Saturday. The impact fatally injured the whale. A passenger was thrown into the water. The Marine Mammal Stranding Center responded to the scene. Authorities plan to move the whale for a necropsy. Despite an initial dip following a US-EU trade deal, gold recovered after weaker-than-expected US non-farm payrolls data. Investors should monitor USDINR movements, as any upside could further support domestic rallies. Technically, gold on COMEX could see some upside from current levels.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/gold-price-prediction-what-is-the-gold-rate-outlook-for-august-04-2025-week-should-you-buy-or-sell-mcx-gold/articleshow/123087844.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/gold-price-prediction-what-is-the-gold-rate-outlook-for-august-04-2025-week-should-you-buy-or-sell-mcx-gold/articleshow/123087844.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 11:23:21 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="53648" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123087904,imgsize-53648.cms"/></item><item><title>Rs 95 crore: HCLTech’s Vijayakumar is highest-paid Indian IT CEO</title><description><![CDATA[HCLTech CEO C Vijayakumar became the highest-paid Indian IT CEO, earning Rs 94.6 crore in FY24-25, driven by strong company performance. His compensation saw a 7.9% increase, while the average employee hike was 3.1%. The Board approved a 71% remuneration hike for Vijayakumar, recognizing his leadership and HCLTech's growth, despite challenging market conditions.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/rs-95-crore-hcltechs-vijayakumar-is-highest-paid-indian-it-ceo/articleshow/123081175.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/rs-95-crore-hcltechs-vijayakumar-is-highest-paid-indian-it-ceo/articleshow/123081175.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 02:28:46 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="33444" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123084431,imgsize-33444.cms"/></item><item><title>Harvard rejects $500 million deal with Trump, says academic freedom is non-negotiable</title><description><![CDATA[Harvard University President Alan M. Garber has denied reports of a $500 million settlement with the Trump administration, stating academic freedom is non-negotiable, according to The Harvard Crimson. The University continues legal action over frozen federal research funding, while peer institutions like Columbia and Brown have already settled. Internal opposition has grown amid fears of policy concessions. Garber’s comments suggest Harvard may pursue a full legal resolution before considering any form of settlement.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/education/news/harvard-rejects-500-million-deal-with-trump-says-academic-freedom-is-nonnegotiable/articleshow/123083380.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/education/news/harvard-rejects-500-million-deal-with-trump-says-academic-freedom-is-nonnegotiable/articleshow/123083380.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 04 Aug 2025 05:22:13 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SANJAY SHARMA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="166380" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123083425,imgsize-166380.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

      <description><![CDATA[SuperK plans to use its ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen its presence in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka, rather than expanding nationwide. “We’re not trying to expand everywhere… the market we’re operating in already has immense depth,” said Neeraj Menta, Co-Founder of SuperK.     <item>
      <title><![CDATA[No interim US-India trade deal yet; Indian exporters brace for 20-25% tariffs as August 1 deadline nears]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/india-us-trade-deal-delay-trump-tariffs-impact-exporters-19644819.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Indian exporters are gearing up for possible US tariffs of 20–25% as the August 1 deadline set by President Trump approaches without an interim trade deal. While the tariff uncertainty has stalled orders, industry leaders say Indian exporters remain competitively placed compared to rivals like Bangladesh and China. Exporters expect the tariffs to impact profit margins more than supply chains, with fresh orders likely once clarity emerges post-deadline. Trade talks are set to resume in August as both countries work toward a broader agreement.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Mon, 28 Jul 2025 23:11:22 +0530]]></pubDate>

    </item>

      <description><![CDATA[Nayara Energy has initiated legal action against Microsoft in Delhi High Court, alleging abrupt suspension of its licensed services including Outlook and Teams. The move follows EU sanctions against the Russia-linked Indian refiner. Nayara claims Microsoft acted unilaterally, restricting access to critical tools without notice, consultation, or recourse.]]></description>
